item.content:encoded:
Simplicity as Enemy

When things are simple and works well people are happy with what they have. Happy people don’t want ‘Change’ - they want to go on with what they have. Then ‘Development’ isn’t neccesary, that’s a problem - for ‘Capital’. Capital needs ‘Growth’ - and don’t get it!

So ‘Simplicity’ and ‘Capital’ don’t go together.

As ‘Capital’ is (in) ‘Power’, ‘Simplicity’ will loose. Simple things thats works well are pulled from the market. New versions that provide ‘Change’ replaces them. Advertising pushes the process. New ‘Needs’ are created - for features people did not know they ’needed’. ‘Sufficiency’ is killed - ‘Capital’ can ‘Grow’.
